issues.description: The problem statement instructs that the repository save method accepts a boolean flag 'force' which must be set to true when saving (so students may expect to call personRepository.save(person, true)). However, the template and solution repositories use the standard JpaRepository.save(Person) signature (no boolean parameter). This is a cross-artifact method-parameter mismatch: following the problem text would lead students to call a non-existent overload and cause compilation errors or confusion.
issues.suggested_fix: Either remove the reference to a boolean 'force' parameter from the problem statement (clarify that personRepository.save(person) is used), or provide/declare the overloaded save(Person, boolean) method in the repository API across template and solution. The simpler and less intrusive fix is to update the problem text to instruct students to call personRepository.save(person) (no boolean), matching the template and solution.
